textPlain: > Based on the photometry and orbital properties, the planet candidate could have a temperature of 225 K, a radius of ≈1-1.1 RJup and a mass between 90-150 MEarth, consistent with RV limits.Hope it has some interesting moons.

I was curious about the acceleration due to gravity at the surface:    G * (120 Earth masses) / (radius of Jupiter ^ 2)

Comes out to 9.7 m/s. Not bad!
225K = -48CSo not exactly cozy.  I'm not sure what the other measurements mean.
> gravity at the surfaceUnfortunately that "surface" is gaseous…
